title: Man fires bullet through floor, wall; hits woman outside house
content:
PROVIDENCE, R.I. -- A man who was showing his rifle to someone inside a home in Mount Pleasant accidentally shot a woman who was in the backyard Friday night, according to Providence police.
Andrew Szurley, 27, of 111 Harris Road, Smithfield, was charged with firing in a compact area, said Lt. Michelle Guerette.
Police were called about the shooting around 9:30 p.m. on Marconi Street. Szurley had a bolt-action rifle that he was showing to someone else, Guerette said, but he hadn't cleared the weapon.
When the rifle went off, it shot through the wood floor and the wall, hitting a 38-year-old woman outside the house, Guerette said.
The woman, who was not identified, was taken to Rhode Island Hospital to be treated for a gunshot wound that appeared to be minor, the lieutenant said.
